intro: Goniothalamus palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Annonaceae family. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
